Author: dukeleto#7326

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: when you submit to jl777, it messes stuff up

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: best would be to branch from jl777 branch, cherry pick your commit or patch or whatever onto that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: then resubmit PR to the same jl777 branch you did

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you might be able to just send it to the dev branch, but I am not sure. James is doing a lot of work for the hardfork coming up and he might not be merging branches as often

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: my `cctests` branch is a branch off of `jl777`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and I submit PR's to jl777 branch

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: then when James feels it's right, he merges jl777 branch to dev. The dev gets merged to master occasionally. so code flows from jl777 -> dev -> master
